de.ralleytn.simple.json.internal

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ralleytn.simple.json.internal.Util

  • public final class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains a few static methods for JSON values.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    FangYidong(fangyidong@yahoo.com.cn), Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)

      • write

        public static final void write(java.util.Map<?,?> map,
                               java.io.Writer writer)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Convert a Map to a JSON string and write it on a Writer. This method will not close or flush the given Writer!
        Parameters:
        map - the Map to write
        writer - the Writer to which the Map should be written to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • write

        public static final void write(java.lang.Object value,
                               java.io.Writer writer)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Encode an Object into JSON text and write it to a Writer.
        Parameters:
        value - the Object to write on the Writer
        writer - the Writer to write on.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getDate

        public static final java.util.Date getDate(java.lang.Object value,
                                           java.text.DateFormat format)
                                    throws java.text.ParseException
        Tries to parse a value to an instance of Date.
        Parameters:
        value - the value that should be parsed
        format - the DateFormat that should be used to parse the value
        Returns:
        an instance of Date or null if the input value was already null
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the value could not be parsed to an instance of Date
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getEnum

        public static final <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> T getEnum(java.lang.Object value,
                                                            java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Tries to parse a value to an enum.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the enum type
        Parameters:
        value - the value that should be parsed
        type - the enum class
        Returns:
        the enum or null if the value could not be parsed
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • escape

        public static void escape(java.lang.String string,
                          java.lang.StringBuilder builder)
        Escapes a string according to the JSON specification.
        Parameters:
        string - the string which should be escaped
        builder - the StringBuilder on which the result will be written
        Since:
        1.0.0
